fixes.title: Injected getFrameContext() via DI into element-locator, aria, click-executor
Document-wide role+name fallback in getElementByRef, inline re-resolution in executeJsClickOnRef and clickWithVerificationByRef
Added waitForNetworkSettle() to page-controller, wired into step-executors after navigation and before snapshot
Shadow DOM ref re-resolution with shadow host path traversal
Auto-scope snapshots to <main> element when no root specified. Reduces footer/boilerplate noise. Gate failed because only 10/30 tests were run (new tests only).

improvements.title: Frame context doesn't persist across CLI invocations
symptoms: Call switchToFrame, next CLI call reverts to main frame
listFrames shows currentFrameId back to mainFrameId
improvements.expected: Frame context should persist with tab session

improvements.title: Hover doesn't support coordinates
symptoms: {"hover": {"x": 100, "y": 200}} not supported
Cannot trigger hover on shadow DOM elements without selector
improvements.expected: Hover should accept x/y coordinates

improvements.title: Key presses in dialogs don't reach input fields
symptoms: Open Monaco Go to Line dialog with Ctrl+G, press number keys - they don't appear in input
Keys may be going to wrong element
improvements.expected: Key presses should reach the focused input in dialogs

improvements.title: Selection lost when clicking toolbar buttons
symptoms: Select text in WYSIWYG editor with Shift+Arrow
Click Bold button - selection is lost before formatting applies
improvements.expected: Option to preserve selection during click

improvements.title: Keyboard shortcuts with modifiers don't trigger SPA event handlers
symptoms: Meta+k dispatches keydown but doesn't trigger GitHub command palette
Shortcut works manually in Chrome but not via CDP
SPA applications listen at document level, CDP events may not trigger listeners
improvements.expected: Keyboard shortcuts with modifiers should trigger same handlers as physical presses
improvements.workaround: Click the button that triggers the same action

improvements.title: Invalid CSS selector doesn't show parsing error
symptoms: {"click": "[[[invalid"} times out instead of immediate error
No indication that selector syntax is invalid
improvements.expected: Immediate error like 'Invalid CSS selector'

improvements.title: Silent exit code 1 without JSON output
symptoms: Some failures return exit code 1 with no stdout/stderr
Hard to debug what went wrong
improvements.expected: Always return JSON with error details

improvements.title: Error messages show duplicate information
symptoms: Error shows "(timeout: 0ms) (timeout: 30000ms)" - timeout reported twice
improvements.expected: Single, clear timeout message

improvements.title: Snapshot returns limited content on some React SPAs
symptoms: Airbnb page snapshot returns only 2 elements (Skip to content, alert)
Complex React SPAs with custom components have sparse accessibility trees
improvements.expected: Snapshot should capture full accessibility tree for React SPAs

improvements.title: captureResult delay too short for tooltips
symptoms: hover with captureResult returns visibleElements: []
100ms delay not enough for JS tooltips to render
improvements.expected: Make delay configurable or increase default

improvements.title: Snapshot shows tooltip role but no text content
symptoms: Snapshot shows '- tooltip' but not the tooltip text
improvements.expected: Include tooltip content in snapshot

improvements.title: Text selectors like button:has-text(...) timeout
symptoms: {"click": "button:has-text('Submit')"} times out
Button is visible in screenshot
Playwright-style :has-text() pseudo-selector not supported
improvements.expected: Support :has-text() pseudo-selector or similar text matching

improvements.title: Drag doesn't work on HTML5 range input sliders
symptoms: Drag returns {"dragged": true} but slider value doesn't change
Click-at-position on slider track works as workaround
improvements.expected: Drag should move the slider thumb and update the value
improvements.workaround: Use click-at-position on slider track or keyboard arrow keys

improvements.title: New tab detection/tracking when links open in new tabs
symptoms: Click a link that opens in new tab, navigated: false returned
No indication that new tab opened
Agent must call chromeStatus to discover the new tab
improvements.expected: Detect when click opens new tab, return info about new tab in response
improvements.workaround: Use chromeStatus after clicks that may open new tabs

improvements.title: getBoundingClientRect() returns empty object in eval
symptoms: eval with el.getBoundingClientRect() returns {}
DOMRect objects not automatically serialized
improvements.expected: DOMRect should be serialized automatically or clearly documented

improvements.title: Scroll reports incorrect position
symptoms: scroll with direction down returns scrollY: 0
Page appears to scroll but reported position is wrong
improvements.expected: Scroll should report correct position after scrolling

improvements.title: Session state accumulation causes issues after extended use
symptoms: After many operations on same tab, click starts timing out
Closing and reopening tab resolves it
improvements.expected: Session should remain responsive after extended use

improvements.title: Framework detection on page load
symptoms: Agents don't know what frameworks a page uses until they encounter issues
Early detection would allow proactive strategy adjustment
improvements.expected: Add framework detection to goto and openTab responses

improvements.title: Lazy selector resolution (eliminate stale refs)
symptoms: Cached element handles can become stale creating stale element errors
Re-resolving selector from scratch for every action would eliminate this class of errors
improvements.expected: Never cache element references, re-resolve selector for every action

improvements.title: MutationObserver-based waiting
symptoms: Polling at 100ms intervals is slower and uses more CPU than event-driven detection
improvements.expected: Use MutationObserver for real-time DOM change detection

improvements.title: XPath support
symptoms: Some DOM traversal patterns are awkward with CSS selectors
improvements.expected: Add XPath selector support alongside CSS

improvements.title: Innermost text matching
symptoms: Text matching can match parent elements containing same text as target child
Leads to wrong element clicks
improvements.expected: Filter text matches to return only innermost matching elements

improvements.title: Frame-scoped snapshots
symptoms: Large pages produce verbose snapshots
When target area is known, capturing only that portion improves efficiency
improvements.expected: Support scoped snapshots via focusSelector

improvements.title: Closed shadow DOM piercing
symptoms: Cannot access closed shadow roots via normal DOM APIs
improvements.expected: Monkey-patch Element.attachShadow() to maintain WeakMap of closed shadow roots

improvements.title: Frame-aware element identification
symptoms: Element refs are scoped to single frame context, requiring manual frame switching
improvements.expected: Encode element IDs as frameOrdinal-backendNodeId pairs, support >> hop notation

improvements.title: Adaptive depth handling
symptoms: Hard depth limits truncate DOM capture with no automatic recovery
improvements.expected: Progressive depth reduction on encoder errors, re-hydrate missing branches

improvements.title: Refs map inlined in every snapshot response
symptoms: Every snapshot response includes full refs map as inline JSON (CSS selectors keyed by ref ID)
HN: ~20KB of CSS selectors. ECMAScript spec: exceeds 1MB
Response size is 2-3x larger than actual snapshot content
improvements.expected: Refs should be written to file or omitted from JSON entirely

improvements.title: viewportSnapshot always included regardless of relevance
symptoms: snapshot with since and unchanged:true still sends 5-10KB viewportSnapshot
snapshotSearch sends full viewportSnapshot alongside targeted results
10-12KB of YAML per response on typical pages
improvements.expected: viewportSnapshot should only be included on action responses

improvements.title: Summary mode includes all refs inline
symptoms: Summary detail level includes ALL refs inline in JSON
ECMAScript spec: summary YAML ~100 bytes but response 1MB+ due to 28,329 refs
improvements.expected: Summary mode should return zero refs

improvements.title: Accessible names not truncated causing snapshot bloat
symptoms: GitHub commit message links have 500-2000 character accessible names
Amazon product names duplicated in parent link + child heading
Full snapshot on GitHub: 57KB (would be ~8KB with name truncation)
improvements.expected: Names truncated to ~150 characters by default, with maxNameLength option

improvements.title: Viewport snapshot includes fixed/sticky navigation in every response
symptoms: ECMAScript spec: fixed TOC sidebar is ~60% of every viewport snapshot
Wikipedia: banner + nav bars repeat in every viewport snapshot
Same banner content processed 5 times in a 5-action workflow
improvements.expected: Option to exclude fixed/sticky elements or auto-detect and omit after first snapshot

improvements.title: Headings and non-interactive elements have no refs in snapshotSearch
symptoms: snapshotSearch returns ref=None for all heading matches
Wikipedia: all 11 section headings return ref=None
Agents must fall back to unreliable text-based clicking
improvements.expected: Headings should get refs as they are navigation targets

improvements.title: Interactive detail level broken on link-dense pages
symptoms: HN: interactive (23,147 bytes) is LARGER than full (15,879 bytes)
Wikipedia: interactive saves only 12% vs full
Interactive removes headings needed for orientation while keeping low-value links
improvements.expected: Interactive should always be strictly smaller than full

improvements.title: since hash ignores element state changes
symptoms: Checkbox toggles don't change the hash
snapshot with since falsely reports unchanged after toggling checkboxes
Dropdown selection causes no hash change after selectOption
improvements.expected: Hash should include lightweight checksum of interactive element states

improvements.title: Combobox/select shows no value in snapshot
symptoms: select elements render as bare 'combobox [ref=s1e1]' with no selected value
After selecting Option 2, snapshot still shows just combobox
improvements.expected: Display like combobox "Option 2" [ref=s1e1] showing selected option

improvements.title: Table cell text missing in default snapshot
symptoms: td and th elements show as empty cell and columnheader without includeText
Default snapshot nearly useless for tabular data
improvements.expected: Table cells should show text content by default
improvements.workaround: Use extract step or snapshot with includeText: true

improvements.title: snapshotSearch fuzzy matching too aggressive
symptoms: 'star' matches 'start', 'started' etc. (no word-boundary awareness)
No relevance scoring, long commit messages rank equally with navigation links
improvements.expected: Default matching should use word boundaries, add fuzzy parameter for control

improvements.title: snapshotSearch results lack state attributes
symptoms: Checkbox search returns refs but doesn't indicate checked status
Combobox search doesn't show selected value
Search matches don't include disabled, expanded, or name attributes
improvements.expected: Add states field to search results

improvements.title: snapshotSearch path context unhelpful on large pages
symptoms: HN: all matches share identical path with no disambiguation
ECMAScript spec: all headings show path 'generic' with no section hierarchy
improvements.expected: Include article/section context in path with nearest named ancestor

improvements.title: Unnamed buttons have no fallback text
symptoms: Buttons with no ARIA accessible name show as 'button [ref=s1e13]'
Agent cannot tell which button dismisses modal vs redirects
improvements.expected: Fall back to innerText, value, title, or child text content

improvements.title: SPA client-side navigation not detected
symptoms: Click on GitHub tab reports navigated: false
URL changes via history.pushState happen asynchronously after click resolves
Affects all SPAs: GitHub (Turbo), Next.js, Nuxt, React Router, Vue Router
improvements.expected: Monkey-patch history.pushState/replaceState and detect URL changes within ~500ms
improvements.workaround: Add explicit wait steps after every link click on SPAs

improvements.title: Same-page anchor navigation causes full page reload
symptoms: goto with #hash fragment on same page causes full page reload
On ECMAScript spec (2.5MB page): anchor navigation takes 32 seconds instead of <1 second
improvements.expected: Detect same-origin URL with only hash difference and use location.hash + scroll

improvements.title: False modal detection from input placeholders
symptoms: GitHub search input placeholder reported as context.modal on every page load
Misleads agents into thinking a dialog is blocking interaction
improvements.expected: context.modal should only be populated for role=dialog or role=alertdialog

improvements.title: selectOption produces no diff/changes
symptoms: After selectOption, response has no changes field
Unlike click and fill, selectOption generates no diff
improvements.expected: selectOption should produce diff showing value change

improvements.title: Text-based click silently matches wrong element
symptoms: click with text 'History' matched navigation link instead of article heading
No disambiguation warning despite multiple matches
improvements.expected: When click(text) finds multiple matches, return error listing all or prefer closest to viewport center

improvements.title: HTML markup leaking into accessible names
symptoms: Amazon results heading contains raw HTML span tags in accessible name
HTML tags should be stripped from accessible name strings
improvements.expected: Strip HTML tags from accessible names during snapshot generation

improvements.title: Page reload invalidates CDP session with no recovery
symptoms: reload destroys CDP session entirely
Tab ID becomes invalid, all subsequent steps fail with CONNECTION error
Must open entirely new tab and redo all setup
improvements.expected: Auto-reconnect to same tab after page reload

improvements.title: Reconnect step for session recovery
symptoms: After session disconnect, no way to re-attach to same tab
Must use chromeStatus + openTab to start fresh, losing all state
improvements.expected: Add reconnect step that tries to re-attach by URL pattern or tab ID

improvements.title: Composite clickAndSnapshot step
symptoms: Click + snapshot is the most common two-step pattern
Requires two CLI invocations adding latency
improvements.expected: Add clickAndSnapshot that performs both in one invocation

improvements.title: waitForSettled step (DOM mutation quiet)
symptoms: After page loads or complex UI transitions, unclear what to wait for
wait requires knowing a specific selector or text
No way to say 'wait until the page stops changing'
improvements.expected: waitForSettled step that waits for no DOM mutations for N milliseconds

improvements.title: Auto-learning from failures
symptoms: Site profiles are entirely manual, agent must remember to call writeSiteProfile
Quirks discovered during sessions are lost if not explicitly recorded
Same failure patterns repeat across sessions
improvements.expected: Auto-append discovered quirks to site profile after failures

improvements.title: Clicking hidden radio/checkbox inputs via refs reports 'ok' status with a warnin
symptoms: Clicking hidden radio/checkbox inputs via refs reports 'ok' status with a warning about visibility, but does NOT actually toggle the input state. The click appears to succeed from the response but has no effect. This is misleading - either the click should actually work (e.g., by automatically clicking the associated label), or it should report a clearer failure indicating the input was not toggled. On demoqa.com, radio buttons and checkboxes use hidden inputs with visible CSS-styled labels, which is an extremely common pattern across modern web frameworks.

improvements.title: TinyMCE editor on the-internet.herokuapp.com is permanently in read-only mode du
symptoms: TinyMCE editor on the-internet.herokuapp.com is permanently in read-only mode due to expired Tiny Cloud API key. The console shows 'All created TinyMCE editors are configured to be read-only' and 'you have no more editor loads available this month'. This means the test cannot be completed via normal user interaction (switchToFrame + fill/type). The only way to set content is via direct DOM manipulation through pageFunction, which bypasses the editor's read-only restriction. This test should either use a self-hosted TinyMCE instance without cloud licensing, or the test expectations should acknowledge that DOM manipulation is the expected approach.

improvements.title: Snapshot returns empty YAML inside frameset frames
symptoms: After switching to frame-left (a frame inside a frameset), snapshot returned {yaml: '', refs: {}}. The accessibility tree may not properly traverse frameset-based frames. Had to use pageFunction as fallback to read text content.

improvements.title: No native file upload support - had to use pageFunction with Dropzone API
symptoms: cdp-skill fill step rejects file inputs as 'not editable'. Had to use pageFunction to call Dropzone.forElement().addFile() to programmatically upload. CDP protocol supports DOM.setFileInputFiles which could be exposed as a dedicated step (e.g., 'uploadFile' or 'setFileInput') for native file upload support without requiring pageFunction workarounds.
improvements.workaround: cdp-skill fill step rejects file inputs as 'not editable'. Had to use pageFunction to call Dropzone.forElement().addFile() to programmatically upload. CDP protocol supports DOM.setFileInputFiles which could be exposed as a dedicated step (e.g., 'uploadFile' or 'setFileInput') for native file upload support without requiring pageFunction workarounds.

improvements.title: Used CSS selector instead of ref after ref-based click failed
symptoms: After two failed attempts to click via ref s1e12, used CSS selector 'table tbody tr:nth-of-type(5) td:nth-of-type(7) a:first-of-type' which succeeded via jsClick-auto fallback. Refs from earlier snapshots should remain valid and clickable regardless of scroll position.
improvements.workaround: After two failed attempts to click via ref s1e12, used CSS selector 'table tbody tr:nth-of-type(5) td:nth-of-type(7) a:first-of-type' which succeeded via jsClick-auto fallback. Refs from earlier snapshots should remain valid and clickable regardless of scroll position.

improvements.title: Time list items outside viewport require force click
symptoms: The react-datepicker time list is a scrollable container where most items are outside the browser viewport. Using ref click failed with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' and jsClick also failed with 'outside viewport'. Had to use force:true which fell back to jsClick-fallback. The scrollUntilVisible option could help but it scrolls the page, not the internal container.
improvements.workaround: The react-datepicker time list is a scrollable container where most items are outside the browser viewport. Using ref click failed with 'Coordinates must be non-negative' and jsClick also failed with 'outside viewport'. Had to use force:true which fell back to jsClick-fallback. The scrollUntilVisible option could help but it scrolls the page, not the internal container.

improvements.title: Multiselect input click needed jsClick fallback
symptoms: Clicking the multiselect input (ref s1e8) required jsClick-auto fallback because the CDP click was intercepted. The auto-fallback handled this transparently.
improvements.workaround: Clicking the multiselect input (ref s1e8) required jsClick-auto fallback because the CDP click was intercepted. The auto-fallback handled this transparently.

improvements.title: Using refs avoids selector escaping complexity
symptoms: When dealing with complex selectors containing quotes or special characters, taking a snapshot first and using refs (e.g., s1e9) is more reliable and easier than managing shell/JSON escaping for data-test attributes.
improvements.workaround: When dealing with complex selectors containing quotes or special characters, taking a snapshot first and using refs (e.g., s1e9) is more reliable and easier than managing shell/JSON escaping for data-test attributes.

improvements.title: Click step errors even when navigation succeeds
symptoms: In call #5, the fill succeeded and triggered form submission/navigation to /secure, but the click step reported an error 'CDP error: Cannot find context with specified id'. The navigation was successful and the page landed on the secure area, but the click step status was marked as error.

improvements.title: Direct section navigation more reliable than search
symptoms: For topic-based searches on Al Jazeera, directly navigating to topical sections (e.g., /climate-crisis, /middle-east) is more reliable than using the site's search functionality. This avoids search result loading issues and reduces steps.
improvements.workaround: For topic-based searches on Al Jazeera, directly navigating to topical sections (e.g., /climate-crisis, /middle-east) is more reliable than using the site's search functionality. This avoids search result loading issues and reduces steps.

improvements.title: Used pageFunction to extract full page text (innerText.substring(0, 5000)) as a
symptoms: Used pageFunction to extract full page text (innerText.substring(0, 5000)) as a reliable way to get structured recipe data including serving size and ingredients. This was more efficient than multiple scroll + snapshotSearch combinations for content-heavy recipe pages.
improvements.workaround: Used pageFunction to extract full page text (innerText.substring(0, 5000)) as a reliable way to get structured recipe data including serving size and ingredients. This was more efficient than multiple scroll + snapshotSearch combinations for content-heavy recipe pages.

improvements.title: Snapshot doesn't show state change after failed drag
symptoms: After the first drag attempt with mouse-events method (call 4), the viewportSnapshot still showed 'banner A' and 'banner B' even though visually the drag occurred. The snapshot didn't reflect that nothing actually changed in the DOM. This made it harder to diagnose that the drag didn't work.

improvements.title: getDom useful for understanding page mechanics
symptoms: Using getDom step to inspect the full page HTML revealed the JavaScript event handlers and HTML5 drag-and-drop implementation details. This helped identify that the page uses HTML5 DnD, not a custom drag library.
improvements.workaround: Using getDom step to inspect the full page HTML revealed the JavaScript event handlers and HTML5 drag-and-drop implementation details. This helped identify that the page uses HTML5 DnD, not a custom drag library.

improvements.title: buildVerifyCapture wraps eval_truthy expressions containing statements in !!() causing syntax errors
get step fails with 'Could not detect data type' for simple text extraction
symptoms: Both `{"get":"#finish h4"}` and `{"get":{"selector":"#finish h4","mode":"text"}}` fail with 'Could not detect data type. Use type: "table" or "list" option.' The error message suggests it's trying to auto-detect a data format when mode:'text' should simply extract textContent. The mode parameter appears to be completely ignored. This forces users to fall back to pageFunction for basic text extraction, which defeats the purpose of having a get step.

improvements.title: fill reports success but value does not persist in fullscreen overlay search inputs
symptoms: When filling the allrecipes.com fullscreen search overlay input (#mntl-fullscreen-nav__search__search-input), the fill step reports status 'ok' but the input's value property remains empty string when checked via pageFunction. This happened twice - first with input[name=q] and then with the expanded overlay input. The fill action appears to dispatch events but the value does not stick, possibly due to the site's JS framework resetting the input or the overlay being a React-controlled component that discards programmatic value changes. The workaround was to navigate directly to the search URL.

improvements.title: drag with method:'auto' defaults to mouse-events which fails on HTML5 DnD sites
symptoms: The 'auto' method (default) for drag chose 'mouse-events' on the-internet.herokuapp.com/drag_and_drop, which uses the HTML5 Drag and Drop API. The drag step reported success (dragged: true) but the elements did NOT actually swap. Only when explicitly using method:'html5' did the drag work correctly. The 'auto' method should detect HTML5 DnD attributes (draggable='true', ondragstart handlers) and automatically select the html5 method. Additionally, the step should not report dragged:true when the drag had no visible effect - this is a misleading success response.

improvements.title: fill reports success but value does not persist in fullscreen overlay search inputs
symptoms: When filling the allrecipes.com fullscreen search overlay input (#mntl-fullscreen-nav__search__search-input), the fill step reports status 'ok' but the input's value property remains empty string when checked via pageFunction. This happened twice - first with input[name=q] and then with the expanded overlay input. The fill action appears to dispatch events but the value does not stick, possibly due to the site's JS framework resetting the input or the overlay being a React-controlled component that discards programmatic value changes. The workaround was to navigate directly to the search URL.

improvements.title: drag with method:'auto' defaults to mouse-events which fails on HTML5 DnD sites
symptoms: The 'auto' method (default) for drag chose 'mouse-events' on the-internet.herokuapp.com/drag_and_drop, which uses the HTML5 Drag and Drop API. The drag step reported success (dragged: true) but the elements did NOT actually swap. Only when explicitly using method:'html5' did the drag work correctly. The 'auto' method should detect HTML5 DnD attributes (draggable='true', ondragstart handlers) and automatically select the html5 method. Additionally, the step should not report dragged:true when the drag had no visible effect - this is a misleading success response.

improvements.title: Click on ref s1e17 triggered unexpected newTabs creation (t204 to challenging_do
symptoms: Click on ref s1e17 triggered unexpected newTabs creation (t204 to challenging_dom). This appears to be spurious tab opening during comment link navigation.

improvements.title: Cross-origin consent iframe blocks interaction on BBC
symptoms: BBC shows a consent modal in a cross-origin iframe (#sp_message_iframe_1355822) that cannot be interacted with via cdp-skill frame switching. Workaround was to navigate directly to the search URL, bypassing the consent modal. A built-in mechanism to handle or dismiss cross-origin consent modals would improve reliability for sites using third-party consent management platforms.
improvements.workaround: BBC shows a consent modal in a cross-origin iframe (#sp_message_iframe_1355822) that cannot be interacted with via cdp-skill frame switching. Workaround was to navigate directly to the search URL, bypassing the consent modal. A built-in mechanism to handle or dismiss cross-origin consent modals would improve reliability for sites using third-party consent management platforms.

improvements.title: Radio button click requires text targeting instead of ref
symptoms: Clicking a radio button ref (f0s1e8) reported 'element not visible' and did not check the radio. Using text-based click with force:true on the label text 'Male' worked. The radio input elements on demoqa have zero dimensions and are styled via CSS custom radio, so ref-based clicks fail silently.
improvements.workaround: Clicking a radio button ref (f0s1e8) reported 'element not visible' and did not check the radio. Using text-based click with force:true on the label text 'Male' worked. The radio input elements on demoqa have zero dimensions and are styled via CSS custom radio, so ref-based clicks fail silently.

improvements.title: Cross-origin detection incorrect for about:srcdoc iframes
symptoms: The mce_0_ifr iframe (about:srcdoc) within previewframe is flagged as cross-origin, preventing click, fill, and other DOM actions. However, the previewframe can access mce_0_ifr's contentDocument just fine from JS, indicating they share an origin. CDP should allow actions in about:srcdoc iframes that inherit their parent's origin.

improvements.title: Used pageFunction in parent frame to set TinyMCE editor content
symptoms: Since direct interaction with the mce_0_ifr frame was blocked by the cross-origin detection, the workaround was to switch to previewframe and use pageFunction to access iframe.contentDocument.body.innerHTML directly. This bypasses the normal click+type workflow.
improvements.workaround: Since direct interaction with the mce_0_ifr frame was blocked by the cross-origin detection, the workaround was to switch to previewframe and use pageFunction to access iframe.contentDocument.body.innerHTML directly. This bypasses the normal click+type workflow.

improvements.title: middle_frame_content milestone eval does not account for nested framesets
symptoms: The eval_truthy for middle_frame_content runs document.querySelectorAll('frame') in the main frame context, but the MIDDLE frame is a child of the frame-top frameset (depth 2), not a direct child of the top-level document. The eval only finds 2 direct <frame> children (frame-top and frame-bottom) and cannot access MIDDLE via contentDocument from the main frame. The eval should either recurse into nested framesets or specify it must run in the frame-top context.

improvements.title: IIFE syntax in pageFunction causes '__fn is not a function' error
symptoms: Passing an IIFE like '(() => { ... })()' to pageFunction fails with 'TypeError: __fn is not a function'. The tool auto-wraps expressions as IIFEs internally, so passing a pre-wrapped IIFE causes double-wrapping. The workaround is to pass arrow functions without invocation: '() => { ... }'. This is documented behavior but the error message is cryptic and could be improved to detect the double-wrap pattern and provide a helpful hint.

improvements.title: Assert text check fails on input element values
symptoms: Using assert with selector and text on an input element fails even when the value matches exactly. The near-match shows score 100 but the assertion still fails. Assert appears to check textContent rather than the input value attribute.

improvements.title: Get mode:value returns error for datepicker inputs
symptoms: Using get with mode:value on #datePickerMonthYearInput and #dateAndTimePickerInput returns 'Element is not a form' error, even though these are standard input[type=text] elements rendered by react-datepicker.

improvements.title: Text-based click fails for React Select dropdown options
symptoms: Using {text: 'Green'} to click a React Select option fails with 'Element not found' even though the dropdown is open and the option is visible. The dropdown options are rendered in a portal div and do not appear as discrete elements in the accessibility snapshot. Workaround: use the internal React Select option IDs (e.g. #react-select-4-option-0) to target options by CSS selector.
improvements.workaround: Using {text: 'Green'} to click a React Select option fails with 'Element not found' even though the dropdown is open and the option is visible. The dropdown options are rendered in a portal div and do not appear as discrete elements in the accessibility snapshot. Workaround: use the internal React Select option IDs (e.g. #react-select-4-option-0) to target options by CSS selector.

improvements.title: Cart state persists across headless sessions
symptoms: When opening saucedemo.com in a new headless tab, cart items from a previous session (same browser instance) are already present. The test had Onesie and Bike Light already added from a prior failed run. The site profile documents this ('items from previous session may persist in cart') but cdp-skill does not automatically handle it. Tests that require a clean cart state may produce false positives or false negatives.

feedback.title: BBC consent iframe is cross-origin and cannot be dismissed via CDP
feedback.detail: The BBC privacy consent modal uses a cross-origin iframe (sp_message_iframe) that cannot be interacted with via CDP. Workaround: remove the iframe element and its parent container via pageFunction before proceeding with page interaction.

feedback.title: Default drag method should try HTML5 before mouse events
feedback.detail: The drag step with method 'auto' used mouse-events first, which did not trigger the HTML5 drag-and-drop API on the-internet.herokuapp.com. The swap only worked after explicitly setting method to 'html5'. Consider having 'auto' detect draggable attribute and prefer HTML5 when present.

feedback.title: Radio button click requires text targeting instead of ref
feedback.detail: Clicking a radio button ref (f0s1e8) reported 'element not visible' and did not check the radio. Using text-based click with force:true on the label text 'Male' worked. The radio input elements on demoqa have zero dimensions and are styled via CSS custom radio, so ref-based clicks fail silently.

feedback.title: Cannot interact with cross-origin consent iframe via CDP frame switching
feedback.detail: BBC's SourcePoint consent dialog is inside a cross-origin iframe (cdn.privacy-mgmt.com). The frame command fails with 'Frame not found' for both CSS selectors and name-based targeting. Workaround was to remove the iframe element via pageFunction on the main page, then dismiss the secondary cookie banner by clicking 'Yes, I agree'.

feedback.title: Draggable elements lack refs in snapshot
feedback.detail: The #column-a and #column-b div elements appear as 'banner' roles in the accessibility snapshot but do not receive refs, making it impossible to use ref-based targeting for drag operations. CSS selectors work fine as a fallback.

feedback.title: Hidden radio/checkbox inputs require clicking labels instead of refs
feedback.detail: On demoqa.com practice form, the radio buttons and checkboxes use hidden native inputs with custom-styled labels. Clicking the snapshot refs (which target the hidden inputs) does not change their checked state. Clicking the label elements (e.g. label[for=gender-radio-1]) works correctly. The click step reported success with a warning about non-visible elements but did not actually toggle the input state.

feedback.title: Cross-origin detection incorrect for about:srcdoc iframes
feedback.detail: The mce_0_ifr iframe (about:srcdoc) within previewframe is flagged as cross-origin, preventing click, fill, and other DOM actions. However, the previewframe can access mce_0_ifr's contentDocument just fine from JS, indicating they share an origin. CDP should allow actions in about:srcdoc iframes that inherit their parent's origin.

feedback.title: Used pageFunction in parent frame to set TinyMCE editor content
feedback.detail: Since direct interaction with the mce_0_ifr frame was blocked by the cross-origin detection, the workaround was to switch to previewframe and use pageFunction to access iframe.contentDocument.body.innerHTML directly. This bypasses the normal click+type workflow.

feedback.title: Clicking on iframe element opens unrelated new tabs
feedback.detail: When clicking on iframe[name=previewframe] or clicking inside the mce_0_ifr frame context, the jsClick-auto fallback triggered navigation to completely unrelated URLs (herokuapp.com, saucedemo.com). This happened twice during the test, requiring cleanup of accidentally opened tabs.

feedback.title: Milestone eval_truthy cannot traverse nested iframes
feedback.detail: The test milestone's eval_truthy checks document.querySelectorAll('iframe') from the main frame, but only sees the top-level previewframe. The TinyMCE content is in a nested iframe (mce_0_ifr) inside previewframe. The eval should recursively check nested iframes or the verification system should support specifying a frame context.

feedback.title: Monaco editor textarea not visible for click targeting
feedback.detail: The Monaco editor hidden textarea (textbox 'JavaScript Input') is reported as not visible when clicking via ref. The site profile correctly advises using Monaco API via pageFunction for reliable text manipulation, which works well. The snapshot correctly identifies the textbox refs but click warns about visibility.

feedback.title: middle_frame_content milestone eval does not account for nested framesets
feedback.detail: The eval_truthy for middle_frame_content runs document.querySelectorAll('frame') in the main frame context, but the MIDDLE frame is a child of the frame-top frameset (depth 2), not a direct child of the top-level document. The eval only finds 2 direct <frame> children (frame-top and frame-bottom) and cannot access MIDDLE via contentDocument from the main frame. The eval should either recurse into nested framesets or specify it must run in the frame-top context.

feedback.title: Add recursive frame content reading capability
feedback.detail: A convenience step like frame with {readAll: true} could automatically traverse all nested frames and return their text content in a structured map, which would simplify tasks involving nested framesets without requiring manual frame-by-frame switching.

feedback.title: Snapshot does not distinguish shadow DOM content from light DOM
feedback.detail: The viewport snapshot renders shadow DOM slotted content inline without any indication that the content originates from shadow roots or uses slot projection. The two <my-paragraph> custom elements with open shadow roots appear as plain list items. An agent relying solely on snapshots would not know shadow DOM is involved and could not target shadow-internal elements via refs. The pierceShadow snapshot option exists but is not surfaced in the default viewport snapshot, and even with it, there is no visual marker differentiating shadow content from light DOM content.

feedback.title: No explicit dialog step type for test automation
feedback.detail: The dialog handler works automatically via CDP Page.javascriptDialogOpening events, auto-accepting alerts/confirms and entering 'Hello CDP' for prompts. However, there is no explicit step type in SKILL.md to queue dialog responses or customize prompt text before triggering a dialog. For test automation, an explicit 'dialog' step (e.g. {"dialog": {"accept": true, "promptText": "custom text"}}) would give agents more control and make dialog handling discoverable. Currently the auto-handling behavior is undocumented in SKILL.md.

feedback.title: Spurious newTabs reported on every click
feedback.detail: Each click on the alert/confirm/prompt buttons reported newTabs opening (e.g. demoqa.com/date-picker, demoqa.com/select-menu, demoqa.com/progress-bar). These appear to be tabs opened by other agents or processes sharing the same Chrome instance, not caused by the button clicks themselves. The click output falsely attributes unrelated tab openings to the current click action, which could confuse automation agents into thinking a navigation occurred.

feedback.title: Test description mentions Dropzone.js but page uses standard HTML form
feedback.detail: The test task description says the page uses Dropzone.js with drag-and-drop, but the actual page at the-internet.herokuapp.com/upload uses a standard HTML file input (#file-upload) and a submit button (#file-submit). The milestones include Dropzone-specific selectors (.dz-filename, .dz-success-mark, .dz-complete) which never match. The milestones still pass because of fallback conditions (h3 text check and body.innerText check), but the primary Dropzone selectors are misleading.

feedback.title: Click on upload submit button reports unrelated newTab from a different site
feedback.detail: After clicking #file-submit to submit the upload form, the response included a newTabs entry with targetId pointing to https://demoqa.com/progress-bar - an entirely unrelated domain. This suggests either a stale tab was incorrectly attributed to the click action, or some background tab event was captured. The upload itself succeeded correctly despite this spurious newTab report.

feedback.title: scroll step should accept CSS selectors to scroll an element into view
feedback.detail: The scroll step only accepts directional strings (up/down/top/bottom) and deltaY/coordinate objects. Passing a CSS selector like 'table' as the scroll target fails with 'Invalid scroll direction'. A common use case is scrolling a specific element into view, which currently requires using a click with scrollUntilVisible or a pageFunction workaround. Supporting scroll-to-element via selector would be more intuitive.

feedback.title: Initial viewport snapshot truncates large tables, requiring extra scroll+snapshot round trip
feedback.detail: The first newTab response viewport snapshot only showed the first row of the 10-row table. Getting the full table required scrolling and taking a full snapshot. For data extraction tasks, the agent needs at minimum 2 extra steps (scroll + snapshot) just to discover all table rows. Consider auto-including full table structure in the snapshot even when rows are below the fold, or providing a table-specific extraction step.

feedback.title: IIFE syntax in pageFunction causes '__fn is not a function' error
feedback.detail: Passing an IIFE like '(() => { ... })()' to pageFunction fails with 'TypeError: __fn is not a function'. The tool auto-wraps expressions as IIFEs internally, so passing a pre-wrapped IIFE causes double-wrapping. The workaround is to pass arrow functions without invocation: '() => { ... }'. This is documented behavior but the error message is cryptic and could be improved to detect the double-wrap pattern and provide a helpful hint.

feedback.title: Assert text check fails on input element values
feedback.detail: Using assert with selector and text on an input element fails even when the value matches exactly. The near-match shows score 100 but the assertion still fails. Assert appears to check textContent rather than the input value attribute.

feedback.title: Get mode:value returns error for datepicker inputs
feedback.detail: Using get with mode:value on #datePickerMonthYearInput and #dateAndTimePickerInput returns 'Element is not a form' error, even though these are standard input[type=text] elements rendered by react-datepicker.

feedback.title: Time list items in datepicker are truncated in viewport snapshot
feedback.detail: The react-datepicker time list contains 96 items (24h x 4 intervals) but the viewport snapshot only shows about 12. There is no way to target off-screen time items via click with text or ref. Had to fall back to pageFunction with scrollIntoView + click to select 10:00.

feedback.title: Text-based click fails for React Select dropdown options
feedback.detail: Using {text: 'Green'} to click a React Select option fails with 'Element not found' even though the dropdown is open and the option is visible. The dropdown options are rendered in a portal div and do not appear as discrete elements in the accessibility snapshot. Workaround: use the internal React Select option IDs (e.g. #react-select-4-option-0) to target options by CSS selector.

feedback.title: React Select dropdown options not exposed in accessibility snapshot
feedback.detail: When a React Select dropdown menu is open, the individual option elements (role=option) are not captured in the accessibility snapshot. Only the ARIA live region text (e.g. 'option Green focused, 1 of 4') appears. Exposing these options as snapshot elements with refs would make interacting with React Select dropdowns much more reliable without needing to know internal CSS selectors.

feedback.title: CDP click consistently intercepted on React Select inputs
feedback.detail: Clicking React Select input elements (#react-select-2-input, #react-select-3-input, #react-select-4-input) always triggers the 'CDP click was intercepted, used JavaScript click fallback' warning. This happens reliably on demoqa.com/select-menu, likely due to the overlay div structure React Select uses. The jsClick-auto fallback works, but the extra attempt adds latency.

feedback.title: Poll step resolves precisely but click latency adds drift
feedback.detail: The poll step detected aria-valuenow reaching 25 after 2344ms, but by the time the subsequent click step executed and stopped the progress bar, the value had advanced to 26%. For timing-critical tasks, a combined poll-and-act primitive that executes the action atomically upon predicate resolution would reduce drift between detection and action.

feedback.title: Cart state persists across headless sessions
feedback.detail: When opening saucedemo.com in a new headless tab, cart items from a previous session (same browser instance) are already present. The test had Onesie and Bike Light already added from a prior failed run. The site profile documents this ('items from previous session may persist in cart') but cdp-skill does not automatically handle it. Tests that require a clean cart state may produce false positives or false negatives.

feedback.title: Shell quoting makes pageFunction with quotes very difficult
feedback.detail: Passing pageFunction expressions that contain double quotes (e.g., document.querySelector('.class')) through shell echo piped to node is error-prone. The single-quote vs double-quote escaping in bash combined with JSON string escaping creates a triple-escaping problem. A file-input mode or stdin without echo would improve ergonomics for complex expressions.

feedback.title: Login click loses tab session without waitAfter
feedback.detail: Clicking the login button without waitAfter:true caused the tab session to become invalid (target closed/detached error). The workaround is to always use waitAfter:true on clicks that trigger full-page navigation. This is documented in the site profile but easy to miss.
